history.text: Good morning
Good morning
Have you ever seen the movie 'Iron Man'?
I have not, what is it about?
Well, it is one of those superhero films, based on the comic book character Iron Man.
I honestly have never seen it either. lol
It sounds like it could be fun to see, do you know who plays in it?
Robert Downey, Jr. plays Tony Stark and Iron Man
Basically a super rich dude that manufactures weapons
I love Robert Downey Jr.
So Tony Stark is Iron Man?
He crafts a suit that turns him into a superhero
Oh neat! I bet his ability to make weapons helps with making a superhero suit
He is indeed, sort of like a Bruce Wayne/Batman deal
It does, turns him into a living weapon, of sorts
What makes Iron Man different from Batman? Is it just the suit that sets them apart?
In essence, the suit is a powered exoskeleton
oh! neat! who is the bad guy in this movie?
It begins with some stereotypical Islamic villain, but then it transitions to Stark's lieutenant in the company, who aimed to take over while Stark was kidnapped by said Islamists.
Wow, so while Stark was kidnapped his lieutenant was trying to take over the company. Does the lieutenant get control of the company?
No, they fight in the end, and Stark wins
However, the lieutenant arranged for the kidnapping to happen, so that he could take over
What?!! Wow, thats crazy. So does the lieutenant have his own suit?
He has one made, so that he can fight Stark
It is much larger, and seemingly more powerful
Makes sense, the villians always have the bigger more powerful things.
is there any comic relief in this movie or is it just all fighting
There are always light hearted moments in movies such as this, but I am not aware of anything specific.
Do you typically go for superhero movies such as this one?
Do you know if they have a romantic plot in the movie?
Stark and his secretary sort of hit it off
I wonder how the government feels about Iron Man, if hes basically is a weaponize suit I would think they would want to control that.
Well, initially, he supplies the government with weapons
After he creates the suit, the Air Force, not knowing who, or what it was, almost shot him down
Does the Air Force figure out who it is?
He comes clean at the end of the movie at a press conference, and admits that he is the Iron Man
Does anyone figure it out before he comes clean?
His friend in the Air Force knows, but other than that, not really

And his friend at the Air Force keeps his secret
 the whole time?
Basically

uid2response.feedback: Engaging conversation, but difficult to talk about a movie that I had not seen before.
